channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Long-Short Distance Graph Neural Networks and Improved Curriculum Learning for Emotion Recognition in Conversation
item.description: Emotion Recognition in Conversation (ERC) is a practical and challenging task.

item.title: One Step is Enough: Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning based on One-Step Policy Optimization for Order Dispatch on Ride-Sharing Platforms
item.description: On-demand ride-sharing platforms face the fundamental challenge of dynamically bundling passengers with diverse origins and destinations and matching them with vehicles in real time, all under significant uncertainty.

item.title: Leveraging Context for Multimodal Fallacy Classification in Political Debates
item.description: In this paper, we present our submission to the MM-ArgFallacy2025 shared task, which aims to advance research in multimodal argument mining, focusing on logical fallacies in political debates.

item.title: Real Time Captioning of Sign Language Gestures in Video Meetings
item.description: In recent studies, it has been found that people with hearing disabilities prefer to sign over typing during these video calls.

item.title: Adaptive Multi-Agent Reasoning via Automated Workflow Generation
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Nexus Architect, an enhanced iteration of our multi-agent system framework, Nexus, equipped with a novel automated workflow synthesis mechanism.

item.title: RaMen: Multi-Strategy Multi-Modal Learning for Bundle Construction
item.description: Existing studies on bundle construction have relied merely on user feedback via bipartite graphs or enhanced item representations using semantic information.

item.title: OntView: What you See is What you Meant
item.description: In this paper, we present OntView, an ontology viewer that is designed to provide users with an intuitive visual representation of ontology concepts and their formal definitions through a user-friendly interface.

item.title: A Reproducibility Study of Product-side Fairness in Bundle Recommendation
item.description: This emerging task introduces additional complexity: recommendations are generated at the bundle level, yet user satisfaction and product (or supplier) exposure depend on both the bundle and the individual items it contains.

item.title: APTx Neuron: A Unified Trainable Neuron Architecture Integrating Activation and Computation
item.description: We propose the APTx Neuron, a novel, unified neural computation unit that integrates non-linear activation and linear transformation into a single trainable expression.

item.title: Tri-Learn Graph Fusion Network for Attributed Graph Clustering
item.description: To address these challenges, this study proposes a novel deep clustering framework that comprising GCN, Autoencoder (AE), and Graph Transformer, termed the Tri-Learn Graph Fusion Network (Tri-GFN).

item.title: Graph-Structured Data Analysis of Component Failure in Autonomous Cargo Ships Based on Feature Fusion
item.description: To address the challenges posed by cascading reactions caused by component failures in autonomous cargo ships (ACS) and the uncertainties in emergency decision-making, this paper proposes a novel hybrid feature fusion framework for constructing a graph-structured dataset of failure modes.

item.title: Making Language Model a Hierarchical Classifier and Generator
item.description: Language heads of the last layer are copied to different selected intermediate layers, and fine-tuned with different task inputs.

item.title: Emergence of Functionally Differentiated Structures via Mutual Information Optimization in Recurrent Neural Networks
item.description: Analysis of network performance, correlation patterns, and weight matrices reveals that mutual information minimization yields high task performance alongside clear functional modularity and moderate structural modularity.

item.title: From Roots to Rewards: Dynamic Tree Reasoning with RL
item.description: Modern language models address complex questions through chain-of-thought (CoT) reasoning (Wei et al., 2023) and retrieval augmentation (Lewis et al., 2021), yet struggle with error propagation and knowledge integration.

item.title: FLEXITOKENS: Flexible Tokenization for Evolving Language Models
item.description: Language models (LMs) are challenging to adapt to new data distributions by simple finetuning.

item.title: DVFL-Net: A Lightweight Distilled Video Focal Modulation Network for Spatio-Temporal Action Recognition
item.description: We employ forward Kullback-Leibler (KL) divergence alongside spatio-temporal focal modulation to effectively transfer both local and global context from the Video-FocalNet Base (teacher) to the proposed VFL-Net (student).

item.title: Best Practices for Large-Scale, Pixel-Wise Crop Mapping and Transfer Learning Workflows
item.description: This study presents the first comprehensive review of large-scale, pixel-wise crop mapping workflows, encompassing both conventional supervised methods and emerging transfer learning approaches.

item.title: Mitigating Object Hallucinations via Sentence-Level Early Intervention
item.description: Multimodal large language models (MLLMs) have revolutionized cross-modal understanding but continue to struggle with hallucinations - fabricated content contradicting visual inputs.

item.title: Simplifications are Absolutists: How Simplified Language Reduces Word Sense Awareness in LLM-Generated Definitions
item.description: However, the scope of the definition changes for different target groups, like children or language learners.

item.title: DAC: A Dynamic Attention-aware Approach for Task-Agnostic Prompt Compression
item.description: Task-agnostic prompt compression leverages the redundancy in natural language to reduce computational overhead and enhance information density within prompts, especially in long-context scenarios.

item.title: InstructFLIP: Exploring Unified Vision-Language Model for Face Anti-spoofing
item.description: Extensive experiments demonstrate the effectiveness of InstructFLIP by outperforming SOTA models in accuracy and substantially reducing training redundancy across diverse domains in FAS.

item.title: Choosing the Better Bandit Algorithm under Data Sharing: When Do A/B Experiments Work?
item.description: Specifically, units under the treatment and control algorithms contribute to a shared pool of data that subsequently train both algorithms, resulting in interference between the two groups.

item.title: FourCastNet 3: A geometric approach to probabilistic machine-learning weather forecasting at scale
item.description: FourCastNet 3 advances global weather modeling by implementing a scalable, geometric machine learning (ML) approach to probabilistic ensemble forecasting.

item.title: Arctic Inference with Shift Parallelism: Fast and Efficient Open Source Inference System for Enterprise AI
item.description: Inference is now the dominant AI workload, yet existing systems force trade-offs between latency, throughput, and cost.

item.title: Efficient Calisthenics Skills Classification through Foreground Instance Selection and Depth Estimation
item.description: Traditional methods for calisthenics skill recognition are based on pose estimation methods to determine the position of skeletal data from images, which is later fed to a classification algorithm to infer the performed skill.

item.title: SpatialTrackerV2: 3D Point Tracking Made Easy
item.description: We present SpatialTrackerV2, a feed-forward 3D point tracking method for monocular videos.

item.title: Developing Visual Augmented Q&A System using Scalable Vision Embedding Retrieval & Late Interaction Re-ranker
item.description: We propose multi-step custom implementation utilizing widely adopted hybrid search (metadata & embedding) and state of the art late interaction re-ranker to retrieve best matching pages.

item.title: PhysX: Physical-Grounded 3D Asset Generation
item.description: 3D modeling is moving from virtual to physical.

item.title: Assay2Mol: large language model-based drug design using BioAssay context
item.description: Scientific databases aggregate vast amounts of quantitative data alongside descriptive text.

item.title: Describe Anything Model for Visual Question Answering on Text-rich Images
item.description: Recent progress has been made in region-aware vision-language modeling, particularly with the emergence of the Describe Anything Model (DAM).

item.title: Analytic estimation of parameters of stochastic volatility diffusion models with exponential-affine characteristic function for currency option pricing
item.description: Chapter four discusses calibration methods for stochastic volatility models, particularly the Heston model, and presents the new Implied Central Moments method to estimate parameters in the Heston and Sch\"obel-Zhu models.

item.title: A Fuzzy Approach to Project Success: Measuring What Matters
item.description: This paper introduces a novel approach to project success evaluation by integrating fuzzy logic into an existing construct.

item.title: Beyond Task-Specific Reasoning: A Unified Conditional Generative Framework for Abstract Visual Reasoning
item.description: Then, we illustrate that, under the proposed framework, training one conditional generative model can solve various AVR tasks.

item.title: Relative Entropy Pathwise Policy Optimization
item.description: Building on these insights, we propose Relative Entropy Pathwise Policy Optimization (REPPO), an efficient on-policy algorithm that combines the sample-efficiency of pathwise policy gradients with the simplicity and minimal memory footprint of standard on-policy learning.

item.title: Langevin Flows for Modeling Neural Latent Dynamics
item.description: Neural populations exhibit latent dynamical structures that drive time-evolving spiking activities, motivating the search for models that capture both intrinsic network dynamics and external unobserved influences.

item.title: Alleviating Textual Reliance in Medical Language-guided Segmentation via Prototype-driven Semantic Approximation
item.description: Medical language-guided segmentation, integrating textual clinical reports as auxiliary guidance to enhance image segmentation, has demonstrated significant improvements over unimodal approaches.

item.title: Optimal Sensor Scheduling and Selection for Continuous-Discrete Kalman Filtering with Auxiliary Dynamics
item.description: Our focus extends to scenarios in which the measurement process is coupled with the states of an auxiliary SSM.

item.title: High-Throughput Distributed Reinforcement Learning via Adaptive Policy Synchronization
item.description: Scaling reinforcement learning (RL) workloads often requires distributing environment simulation across compute clusters.

item.title: Hashed Watermark as a Filter: Defeating Forging and Overwriting Attacks in Weight-based Neural Network Watermarking
item.description: Specifically, we utilize a hash function to generate an irreversible binary watermark from a secret key, which is then used as a filter to select the model parameters for embedding.

item.title: GeoDistill: Geometry-Guided Self-Distillation for Weakly Supervised Cross-View Localization
item.description: In GeoDistill, the teacher model localizes a panoramic image, while the student model predicts locations from a limited FoV counterpart created by FoV-based masking.

item.title: AI Wizards at CheckThat! 2025: Enhancing Transformer-Based Embeddings with Sentiment for Subjectivity Detection in News Articles
item.description: This paper presents AI Wizards' participation in the CLEF 2025 CheckThat!

item.title: Interpretable Bayesian Tensor Network Kernel Machines with Automatic Rank and Feature Selection
item.description: We propose Bayesian Tensor Network Kernel Machines, a fully probabilistic framework that uses sparsity-inducing hierarchical priors on TN factors to automatically infer model complexity.

item.title: SystolicAttention: Fusing FlashAttention within a Single Systolic Array
item.description: The frequent data swaps between the systolic array and external vector units result in low systolic array utilization.

item.title: Precision Spatio-Temporal Feature Fusion for Robust Remote Sensing Change Detection
item.description: Remote sensing change detection is vital for monitoring environmental and urban transformations but faces challenges like manual feature extraction and sensitivity to noise.

item.title: Try Harder: Hard Sample Generation and Learning for Clothes-Changing Person Re-ID
item.description: Hard samples pose a significant challenge in person re-identification (ReID) tasks, particularly in clothing-changing person Re-ID (CC-ReID).

item.title: MMOne: Representing Multiple Modalities in One Scene
item.description: We address the essential distinctions among modalities by disentangling multimodal information into shared and modality-specific components, resulting in a more compact and efficient multimodal scene representation.

item.title: Neurosymbolic Reasoning Shortcuts under the Independence Assumption
item.description: The ubiquitous independence assumption among symbolic concepts in neurosymbolic (NeSy) predictors is a convenient simplification: NeSy predictors use it to speed up probabilistic reasoning.

item.title: U-RWKV: Lightweight medical image segmentation with direction-adaptive RWKV
item.description: Achieving equity in healthcare accessibility requires lightweight yet high-performance solutions for medical image segmentation, particularly in resource-limited settings.

item.title: A Parallelizable Approach for Characterizing NE in Zero-Sum Games After a Linear Number of Iterations of Gradient Descent
item.description: We study online optimization methods for zero-sum games, a fundamental problem in adversarial learning in machine learning, economics, and many other domains.

item.title: AdaMuon: Adaptive Muon Optimizer
item.description: We propose AdaMuon, an adaptive learning-rate framework built upon the recently validated Muon optimizer, which has demonstrated substantial efficiency gains over AdamW in large-scale model training.
